snippet.title: Hissatsu! - Sega Saturn
snippet.description:
Thanks for viewing - please LIKE and subscribe!

Hissatsu! is a polished platformer based I suppose in Imperial Japan - it might look a little '16 bit' but it really plays pretty much like a decent 32 bit 90's platformer with  excellent sprites, animation, graphics and ultra smooth scrolling. It's very well presented and as long as you don't mind skipping through the Japanese texted storyline and just getting into the action you'll be plain sailing.

Four characters are available to play with all with different weapons but the game uses a tag-team system so you pick two of your team of four for whatever level you are on and swap them depending on who can take on the situation better - all in all it's a fun game and with the exception of Shinobi, not much else like it on the Saturn - not playable games by non-Japanese speakers, anyway.
